website_summaries.verdict: This 4 gal. backpack sprayer delivers up to 150 psi and takes fewer than 5 pumps to build pressure.
pros: Brass components, inline filter, and lockable shutoff
Strong, rigid, and easy to use
cons: If you have trouble lifting it from the ground, consider placing it on a bench or table and slipping into the harness

customer_reviews.title: Wrong description-No Folding Handle-Poor customer service from Field King
customer_reviews.text: The description provided to Amazon is incorrect. "Easy access pump with fold-away pump handle for easy storage and also can change seals in just minutes with no tools". This model DOES NOT come with a folding handle. The photo that shows handle in resting upright position is wrong. It stays horizontal and sticks way out for storage. I called customer service at Field King and spoke to a Customer Service Rep who gave me wrong information, then her supervisor who took no responsibility for this and blamed the wrong description on Amazon. Very poor customer service. This is listed as "Amazon's Choice". I hope they remove that recommendation. They don't deserve it.
customer_reviews.author: Herald Ranch

customer_reviews.title: Save the box because it shows all the features like which nozzle to use for various jobs
customer_reviews.text: Some suggestions. 1. Save the box because it shows all the features like which nozzle to use for various jobs. The manual is next to worthless. 2. A feature not mentioned is when pumped up you can spray trees up to about 20 feet into the air. 3. easy to assembly( only one bolt to attach handle to unit), fill, lever to keep pressure up, comfortable to wear on back.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Works like it should.
customer_reviews.text: Own 3 of these. We control brush using a mix of Remedy and diesel fuel and this sprayer handles it fine. Good pressure. Doesn't have an annoying pressure relief valve that keeps popping open. Excellent shoulder harness, someone put some thought in to it when it was designed. I can wear this thing all day without killing my back. The spray wand is made from poly tubing (which I actually prefer over stainless steel). I threw away my Solo after I bought this without any regrets. The only con so far is that the rubber grip slips off the handle sometimes....a little gorilla tape fixed that. The trick to sprayer longevity is to always wash it out after each use.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Diamond

customer_reviews.title: Arrived used and broken
customer_reviews.text: The reviews looked good; the box looked fine. But when I opened the sprayer, it had a liquid in it and was obviously used. Disgusting and dangerous - Who knows what was in this sprayer before? Also a piece was broken, so the backpack strap attachment wouldn't even work. It is unacceptable to sell a used product as new.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Elam

customer_reviews.title: Bad rubber seals - Bad customer support
customer_reviews.text: Used only for viger and water mix to kill weeds. Within 2-3 use the seal at top began to degrade although not all pressure was lost. Within a few months of only 4-5 uses the interior seals at pump went bad and it began leaking on my back. After being on hold with their customer support the women told me the (only) associate that handles returns is not here but I can leave a messege.... 1 1/2 weeks later no call back. (I only want an exchange/credit for a better product)
customer_reviews.author: GenesisB

customer_reviews.title: If I wanted a sprayer that dribbled, I would have kept my old one.
customer_reviews.text: With the red spray tip and with and without the pressure regulator, it just dribbles out the end. Which is what my old one started doing. I did not coat the seals with Vaseline as in the demo video, it would have been nice if there were words with the video to tell you to turn the diaphragm a quarter turn to remove it. Wil empty everything, wash it out, and try again tomorrow. Next time I will drive to HD and buy one that works the first time out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: John Bailey

customer_reviews.title: No Leak is BS.
customer_reviews.text: This No Leak pump leaked out of the clamped hose and the the main tank. 2-4 D and Roundup dribbling down my back.UGH!! Wrote a complaint 2 days ago.STILL NO RESPONSE!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: don't waste your time and money
customer_reviews.text: I've used backpack sprayers for 50 years, usually SOLO. I made the mistake buying this piece of junk. Fifth time I used it, starts dripping where the wand hose connects to tank at the bottom. "No Leak Pump Backpack Sprayer "???? What a joke! Thankfully, I wasn't spraying weed killer when the contents leaked out all over my pants and legs. Back to SOLO for me.
customer_reviews.author: onthewaygirl

customer_reviews.title: Fits comfortably on back and has a low pressure nozzle ( ...
customer_reviews.text: Fits comfortably on back and has a low pressure nozzle ( which is good for spraying herbicides ). Added benefit is that the nozzles are metal and not plastic so they will last much longer than the plastic ones.
customer_reviews.author: Keith M

customer_reviews.title: Excellent All Purpose Sprayer
customer_reviews.text: This sprayer works as advertised. Very pleased with spray length with "standard" spray head-- can reach tops of my apple trees and cherry tree for treatment of Japanese beetles. Heavy spraying does require pretty constant pumping. It seems quite sturdy, but also is rather heavy-- even heavier when full, so I usually only fill it with two gallons. Two gallons is usually enough unless I use it to spot spray weed killer in gravel drive and turning area. I expect it to be more reliable and no heavier than a back pay electric sprayer. The harness is set up like a good back pack harness and is comfortable once the sprayer is in place.
customer_reviews.author: E. Solitude

customer_reviews.title: Researched Many Sprayers - Dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: I researched a lot of back pack sprayers. Stihl, Echo etc. I was looking for a quality back pack sprayer and was extremely disappointed with this back pack sprayer. Ten minutes after I started using the sprayer for the first time it was leaking down my back. Not happy with the herbicide all over by clothes and body.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Occasionally, a company demonstrates its true character by doing something really nice. The Field King sprayer I ordered off Amazon arrived with a broken plastic strap clip/cinch which rendered the sprayer unusable until I could track down a compatible clip. So I thought I'd try customer service...laughable, right? But the Fountainhead Group, which makes the sprayer, fixed the problem via the mail in a couple of days, and did it in an above the call of duty manner. The sprayer itself works great, and has a build quality similar to sprayers selling at a much higher cost. Gotta love outfits that care about their customers.
customer_reviews.author: PDC

customer_reviews.title: Top sprayer
customer_reviews.text: So far I can't fault this sprayer. Works as advertised. Don't know about the reviewer that said the cap leaked all over him when full. Probably missing something or cross-threaded. Makes different noises when you pump it up compared to the Solo, but infinitely more comfortable to wear than the Solo. Nothing cheap or weird about this unit. Would buy another. *Update. This unit works flawlessly now into the second season of hard use. No problems with leaking or fluid coming out the top while using. Only problem is the cover grip for the pump handle slips off or tries to. That could be glued.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin F

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't pressurize
customer_reviews.text: Nothing to like about the one I bought. The unit doesn't pressurize, and had liquid in the tank and hose when I opened the package. Returning it for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Tamartini

customer_reviews.title: 3 Years Before First Leak - Now Awful
customer_reviews.text: It lasted 3 years of normal home owner use - mostly Roundup. Flushed often - I take good care of my stuff. Now it running continuously down my waste / legs - to a degree that makes it unusable. No one makes anything to last anymore. UPDATE: I puchased the "rebuild kit" with all new O-rings and such. In disassembling the sprayer I found the busted seal and replaced it, but oh gee, the hose is also leaking and they don't give you replacement parts for the hose. The replacement hose is an extra $25 dollars. I'm really tired of products built to last 2-3 years.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Dave

customer_reviews.title: Leaks
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used it three times. The third time it leaked. It worked very well at first but I am disappointed that this is advertised as a no leak sprayer when you can clearly see it’s leaking. I tightened that area that was leaking and it has since stopped but it took two months and three uses for it to fail. Very disappointed. This shouldn’t be happening especially when this is used to spray herbicides that you really should not be getting on your skin. I also followed all cleaning instructions so it was not user error. I’m giving this three stars only because I was able to fix it and it works well otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Cam T.

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to use and well mde
customer_reviews.text: We has to combat an infestation of sod webworms this year which entailed spraying our entire yard with two different types of liquid insect treatments. we have a one gallon garden sprayer with the pump handle on top which takes about 3 hours to do the yard. I looked a number of larger ones and settled on this one. It provides a much more robust coverage in about an hour. My wife uses it and loves it. there are several spray head options that can adjust the coverage. It's well worth the money. You can pump and spray at the same time so you can cover a lot of ground in a short time.
customer_reviews.author: David S.

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a 62 year old female. That right there can make this home task a challenge. I also live on a very steep hill. I was able to carry this sprayer fully filled with no problem at all. I sprayed almost 1/2 an acre on a hillside of some very dense weeds in no time at all. No back or shoulder pain and it feels well balanced. Love the nozzle length and spray options. It also hold pressure longer than others I've owned. Well made and I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: wbc

customer_reviews.title: Leaks
customer_reviews.text: I have gone through three backpack sprayers: on two the O ring at the top of the tank stretched and broke seal (Fieldking and Roundup) so that fluid leaked out and down my back. In the third (Fieldking) a leak developed where the sprayer hose fits into the tank and leaked down my back from there. Each tank lasted for about four uses. Each tank worked quite well until the problem developed. You can't buy parts so the next step is to buy a new tank. They all advertise that theirs doesn't leak but that has not been my experience.
customer_reviews.author: milt owens

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use manual pump sprayer. A few pumps every 30 seconds keeps the pressure constant. Large capacity for doing big jobs. Bought this to spray herbicide on weeds, very large yard. This provides sufficient broad coverage. The handle can be mounted on either side of the tank. Long hose sprayer so no bending over, multiple attachments for different jobs. The tank has a wide mouth for easy filling and adding of chemicals, no leaks in mine as opposed to other posters when I was researching. Do what the manufacturer recommends and keep all suggested parts lubricated and I feel this sprayer will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: JTM

customer_reviews.title: Non Folding Pump Handle issue
customer_reviews.text: Contrary to product photographs...the pump handle DOES NOT fold up to the position shown (appears that picture shows handle with bolt not installed allowing it to be rotated up to a non functional position). When installed with the retainer bolt...the handle sticks forward at a 60 degree angle. I have another unit and am familiar with how it works. To resolve the problem, I removed the handle from an old Solo backpack sprayer - whose handle did rotate - and fortunately it fit. Worth the problem as noted that the price had been raised $20 since I purchased the sprayer 3 days before.
customer_reviews.author: Lens Artist

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Wish I bought it earlier.
customer_reviews.text: So much better than the ones that you sit on the ground and pump. This thing is awesome. Wish the handle was designed to store vertically to save space but it does not. It screws in and rests at a 45 degree angle. To make it quicker to remove and store I drilled out the threads and bought one of those bolts with holes and a cotter pin. Fits perfect and allows for handle removal for storage without any tools.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Works great but straps are meant to save money, not comfort.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to spray brawd leaf weeds like dandelions. I believe its about 3 gallons. Thats a lot of weight , I wish the manufactured used a thicker cushioned shoulder straps. Instead it used a basic school pack strap. I believe I will only fill it half way and spray next time. Even if I have to fill it twice it will be more comfortable to cart around on your back. This is coming from a guy used to hiking with a 50lbs backpack. I suppose I could take straps off of a hiking pack? Shouldn't have to though if the company had spent just a little more money?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great sprayer
customer_reviews.text: I use backpack sprayers a great deal. Our hunting club trades rights with a large ranch for labor, we spray invasive plants (gorse mostly) for the ranch. Last "work party" our crew sprayed nearly 500 gallons (that the ranch provides). Many great features. As good as if not better than the Solo it replaced. Much better harness, they don't get much better. Like how the pump parts can't leak down your back like when the Solo blew a diaphragm (second one, but it did have a ton of miles on it). Great deal, great sprayer for the price, can't beat it.
customer_reviews.author: THOMAS

customer_reviews.title: Ideal for homeowners who do significant spraying around their homes and gardens
customer_reviews.text: My only regret is not having bought this sooner! I spray a lot of compost tea and previously used a cheap jug-type sprayer that continually clogged and was awkward to use. Because it has an easy-to-clean final filter just ahead of the wand assembly, using it with aerated compost tea that's full of little critters works fine with occasional filter spritzing. The backpack design is a godsend, allowing me to easily shoulder 4 gallons thanks to the padded shoulder straps plus chest and waist fasteners. The pump handle is very ergonomic and uses far less energy than the piston pump (that died) on my old Ace hardware sprayer.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Paule

customer_reviews.title: Not my favorite.
customer_reviews.text: I have used several different kinds of sprayers in the past. While this one is quite functional and does it’s job, it’s the worst one I’ve used. While it boasts high pressure the pressure container is very small so you constantly have to pump while spraying. Also the sprayer seems to go through quite a bit of liquid compared to other sprayers I’ve used even with the restricting valve on it. I would not recommend this sprayer.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great Sprayer
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and really easy to use. The first time I sprayed my yard, I filled it to capacity - it's kind of heavy. The second time I filled to 3 gallons - nicely manageable. The sprayer tip sprays evenly (I sprayed whole yard). Pump as you go - just get into a rhythm and you can maintain even pressure with continuous spraying. No leaks.
customer_reviews.author: Gracee

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and efficient
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of using the hand spray ready mixed pesticides from the big box stores. I have a large property and weeds are a major maintenance problem. I tried the smaller cannister type but found it was awkward to keep them pumped up and tiring to carry around. I was able to load this sprayer with as little as 1 gallon of mix or 4 gallon as needed. I am a 66yr old woman and I found that if I set it on a table once it was loaded to get into the rig it was very comfortable to walk around and spray where needed. Cleans up easily.
customer_reviews.author: Dani Lee

customer_reviews.title: Heavy and a little awkward for me...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to spray weed and feed on my lawn. It’s a great design but geared more man-sized folks. I had to tighten it as much as possible to sit in the correct position on my back and it’s heavy when loaded up with whatever you’re spraying on your lawn. I’m pretty strong and this wreaked havoc on my neck and shoulders. The pump handle was easy to use and felt intuitive, I just wish the straps allowed for a tighter fit.
customer_reviews.author: R. Michael

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy product, almost perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Complaints about the liquid inside... I’m pretty sure that’s a minimal amount of liquid to keep the seals from drying up. Mine was new and sealed and it had this. Knocked off 1 star because of the handle situation. The description is accurate, but it attached with a bolt and locking nut. Not easy to remove, and takes a lot of space to store it with the handle installed. I’ll be finding a thumb screw to replace the factory bolt that attached the pump handle.
customer_reviews.author: Matt C Erickson

customer_reviews.title: Arrived with chemicals all over!
customer_reviews.text: Got everything setup and ready to go. When I opened the tank up to fill, there was a ton of liquid inside. It was absolutely used because it smelled like heavy chemicals. This is totally unacceptable as I have no idea what was in there. Not to mention I purchased it "new". Extremely disappointed. I should have listened to some of the other reviews but I thought, "This won't happen to me!" I was wrong. Get something else.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy sprayer
customer_reviews.text: I used it to wash the stucco on my house and it was a lifesaver from using a small pump sprayer. It has had bleach, simple green, and roundup in it at different time and has held up to all. Haven’t had it for long but seems to be sturdy. Comes with different tips and easy to use. Would like fold up handle for storage, but not an actual issue. Would recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren d

customer_reviews.title: Quality Sprayer!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this sprayer for a year and have had no problems whatsoever with it. It is comfortable to wear even when full and is much better than lugging around a 2 gallon hand held sprayer. It comes with all the nozzles you could possibly need and is made very well. Proper care and cleaning of this tool and it should last for many years.
customer_reviews.author: Zrob213

customer_reviews.title: Main gasket breaks.  Entire backpack leaks.  Customer support is non existent.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this 1.5 years ago. Used it rarely. Main gasket is cracked and everything leaks. Tried to email customer service....1 week, no response. I should have believed all the other reviews about leaks. For those who need new seal or gasket for this piece of trash, amazon has it listed here. Save your money and get some other brand.
customer_reviews.author: khoi

customer_reviews.title: Easy to pump! Good spray distance.
customer_reviews.text: ****update**** after product day for 2 weeks, tye spray nozzle works 25%as well as it did day one. Trouble shot it down to the spray optimization section and spray nozzle. Can’t adjust or dissect the this area since it has a massive Allen key head. Bigger than anything that comes standard in a normal set. 15x bigger than it needs to be.. Easy to fill. Weight is properly distributed when full. Doesn’t take much to pump.
customer_reviews.author: Cory

customer_reviews.title: Poor Handle Design Ruins the Entire Thing
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, one of the stupidest designs for a handle on this backpack sprayer. Does not fold completely up or down for storage. Sticks out a good foot and a half in front the sprayer so that you cannot store the sprayer flat anywhere, definitely not hanging against a wall. Takes up a lot more space than necessary. And the handle is bolted on (not quick release) so you don’t even have the option of easily removing the handle for storage. Gave 2 stars because it works well but seriously, I don’t care how it works- the handle design makes it extremely inconvenient to store.
customer_reviews.author: Roger E.

customer_reviews.title: Great sprayer!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this sprayer because of the reviews. I really like the tank size and it truly does not leak as specified in the description. I am a small petite woman, in my 60's and I had no problem using it. I filled the tank with 3 gallons of spray and for the first time ever had enough to spray my yard and patio without having to refill the tank. The backpack was far better than the smaller sprayer I've used in the past. The long pump extension made it easy to keep the pressure in the tank. I am extremely happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: C. Dean

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and works great.
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to spray a 1/2 acre site regularly to clear all plantation. I generally use a broadcast sprayer, but it misses a few spots and this is much better than hand-held models in terms of comfort, ease of use and capacity. Assemby is pretty much brainless. When filled, it might be a bit heavy for smaller persons. The wand and pump works well and there really is little to no leak at all. Be warned, make sure there is no liquid in the wand when stored for winter in subfreezing areas. It will crack.
customer_reviews.author: YouMaybeRightIMaybeCrzy

customer_reviews.title: The diaphragm pump broke after a season of use. ...
customer_reviews.text: The diaphragm pump broke after a season of use. If you want to re-purchase this product every year than this sprayer is for you. They build these things cheap and sell them knowing the cheap quality will make you re-buy the product again and again. Where does the madness end? It ends with me doing more research to find a professional quality spray built by a company with integrity.
customer_reviews.author: Marty Weil

customer_reviews.title: Decent Sprayer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this sprayer as a backup sprayer to apply non-selective herbicide. The diaphragm design works pretty well and holds pressure nicely so you aren't constantly pumping. The sprayer and all parts are made of plastic including the wand. I would give it 5 stars if there were some more durable parts, as the wand has a slight bend in it over time. Also some of the seals have worn out and leaking has begun at the nozzle. I'll be replacing seals to see if I can get another year of use.
customer_reviews.author: DragonBreath

customer_reviews.title: Don't know why I waited so long to buy
customer_reviews.text: After years of using the hand pumping 1 gallon size to spray herbicides, switching to a backpack sprayer almost made the spraying job fun rather than a chore. If you're on the fence whether or not to spring for this model, just do it. The backpack straps across your waist and chest make this more or less comfortable to wear even when filled to capacity.
customer_reviews.author: S. Abbott

customer_reviews.title: Pump handle is amazing
customer_reviews.text: I struggled with the typical piston pump sprayers for decades. Although it may seem like a lot of money at first the convenience and capacity of the backpack are worth every single penny. Assembly took 2 minutes. Pressure relief valve on the filling cap is nice as well. Fewer than 6 pumps to reach almost full pressure with a full tank and it is so easy to pump. Ive only had it a month but I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: Been looking for a backpack sprayer for some time. Purchased this King sprayer after reading many reviews and have thus far not been disappointed. Some reviews have suggested that the backpack is not as comfortable as others, but I have found it extremely comfortable and easy to put on. Even when full I hardly notice the weight. Have not yet had it long enough to address longevity or durability, but frankly for what it costs I would be happy even if I had to replace it every couple years. So far I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Don Powers

customer_reviews.title: Broke after a year
customer_reviews.text: We bought this last year to spray the weeds at our house. It worked great at first but stopped working after about a year. The pressure just built up but nothing came out. We did everything we could to troubleshoot but just ended up getting splashed with herbicides. I wish there was a warranty, but I will not be replacing this since it broke with just light use.
customer_reviews.author: Joey Deak

customer_reviews.title: Tank Won't Pressurize ... Extremely Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: After just one-use, the system does not pressurize properly. I would highly recommend considering another product if you're looking for a "professional" pump backpack sprayer. This product is positioned as professional-grade ... sorry Dr. Smith -- not even close.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Sprayer has been used & missing parts!
customer_reviews.text: Sprayer arrived today. Shipping and product box were undamaged, but when opening notice water all inside the plastic bag around the sprayer & inside of it. It’s also missing all of the wand accessories. I’ll stick with Solo brand...
customer_reviews.author: Keb

customer_reviews.title: 2 years, still working great
customer_reviews.text: I've used this for 2 years now, filled with synthetic permethrin, no issues, no leaks, I've stored it outside in the Florida heat on the front porch, and other than collecting dust, has had no mechanical failures. I just sprayed today, house, front and backyard, and it functions the same as the first day (8 gallons). Sorry, no histrionic diatribes about catastrophic failures leading to poisoning my face, it just does what it advertises. Electric sprayer are great, but expensive, and the hand pump is not bad.
customer_reviews.author: Chuong

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and can spray in a bunch of different ways
customer_reviews.text: So far it seems very study. Hardware looks good. Only drawback is the amount of space it takes in my shed. I can apply bug spray around second story windows with killer precision (PUN INTENDED)! I don't have to go on my roof anymore for it. That alone is worth it!!
customer_reviews.author: gandalf

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I weigh 125 lbs am a 72 year old female and this is easy for me to use. It has a wide spray and I was tired of spraying one weed at a time The pressure handle works great and it is easy to clean. I only fill it with 2 gallons of liquid because that is all I can handle
customer_reviews.author: Suzette Tandy

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only used it one time so far but it works great. Be sure to read the instruction manual thoroughly and clean it and dry it out after every use. Don’t leave liquids in it after you put it away and the seals will last longer. The biggest failure point with all of these sprayers are the seals. So far I’m happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mike A

customer_reviews.title: The canister came wet
customer_reviews.text: The canister was wet upon the arrival as well as a wand. Looks like it was used. I'll check how it works and update this posting. On one of the reviews I read that the wet canister comes after the factory test, it explains the issue I've mentioned above. I used this sprayer and I really like it. All tips work perfectly. The pressure is good, I was able to spray high trees. Sits on the body perfectly. The small issue is that you have to pump it pretty often, but it is pretty easy. So, I change the score from 3 to the 5 starts.
customer_reviews.author: Vladimir

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought Field King Profession May/2020 3 months and started leaking all over my back. I hated I only use it once a month to spray weed killer. Very disappointed I wouldn’t recommend. Money wasted I should’ve read the bad reviews . I always bought SOLO brand before. I don’t know why I bought this Field King Professional. It’s a Piece of junk
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Somo

customer_reviews.title: Outlasts the others.
customer_reviews.text: 2nd of this brand I've purchased. The other brands do well for a while but start leaking at the wand tip. Keep a good silicon lubricant on the pump action in the back. Will make it quieter when pumping. Had a few people think I was stepping on a dog because of the sound. I run a lot of cleaning solution through it using both alkaline and acid. Good flow rate with both. Filter in top keeps trash out. Probably another reason it lasts longer.
customer_reviews.author: George Barnett

customer_reviews.title: quality and durable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use to water my more than 50 super large houseplants ( I'm talking about super large philodendron monsteras) outside I have tried all types of pump sprayers through the years and this field king professional backpack sprayer is the very best ever I use it daily I absolutely love it it is easy to handle and is perfect to apply the necessary foods my plants need. thank-you field king .
customer_reviews.author: deborah wilkerson

customer_reviews.title: It worked very well and the nozzles are easy to switch out
customer_reviews.text: My husband ordered this to apply Permethrin to tents and clothing for outdoor use. It worked very well and the nozzles are easy to switch out. He likes that the pump and gaskets are almost all internet to the tank to minimize exterior leak points. Pressure relief is not as robust as he had anticipated (it's a bleed bladder which is just rubber or silicone and is prone to wearing out as opposed to a mechanical pull tab or screw bleed) but those parts are easily and inexpensively replaced. So far, a great improvement over the non-back-pack spray pump have for weed spraying.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: Very good backpack sprayer
customer_reviews.text: I have only sprayed three gallons of weed killer but so far I should have got this thing years ago. Very easy to place on your back and comfortable to carry, very easy to choose which spray nozzle meets your need, very, very easy to keep pumped up. All I ever had was the one and two gallon bottle type pump sprayers and they will work you to death. This backpack sprayer is a charm. Not to even talk about the great price for such a well made sprayer.
customer_reviews.author: Wild Bill

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great, easy to add pressure to tank on the run, adjustable spray nozzle. Only caveat is that 4 gallons (full tank) is a bit heavy on your back. Maybe too heavy for the 'not-so-strong'. I have reduced fill to 2 gallons and that lasts as long as I want before taking a break. Maybe a smaller unit would be a better choice?
customer_reviews.author: Scott McKee

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: My first backpack sprayer. I have used it twice and it is working great so far. I am especially impressed with the internal pump and pressure chamber. So much easier than carrying multiple 1gal sprayers for a big job. This is a great value. If this pack holds up, I will spring for the folding handle model next time.
customer_reviews.author: hds

customer_reviews.title: Works great! I have about 2 acres of apple trees ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great! I have about 2 acres of apple trees and grape vines and not only did this thing cover it all but I was able to go around my entire house and almost every big tree on my property with only one tank. Very good!
customer_reviews.author: Rebel

customer_reviews.title: Be freaking careful of the bottom bulkhead
customer_reviews.text: I am sooo freaking angry! The one place that this thing need to be secure is at the bottom connection of the tank. Basically the bulkhead between the pump and hose. Why? Because if that thing leaks... you Basically getting spray all over your legs and the ground with chemical!! Right now, i wish that it was only leaking... but instead it completely broke and "blew" off causing a massive amount chemical spray all on my legs. Not sure if it was a defect or not...but my goodness, this rot
customer_reviews.author: asian man

customer_reviews.title: Great Value for the Money
customer_reviews.text: I have owned several good backpack sprayers that I used for my lawn. This sprayer is excellent with features not included on my others (back straps designed to better distribute the load; variety of spray nozzles for various patterns; etc.). I have already used it several times and it works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Nancee Skipper

customer_reviews.title: The pump action is easy. The only complaint I have is I wish ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used it a few times since I got it. All I can say is it is a huge time saver. What used to take 4 hours takes about 2. I can fill this thing up and spray my entire property no problem. The pump action is easy. The only complaint I have is I wish it would hold pressure for a while longer but it still works great the way it is. Assembly is easy. The entire thing is just really easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Mcleland

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought this years ago
customer_reviews.text: I've been spraying with cheap canister pump sprayers and they always seem wimpy. This is very well made and feels solid. Sprays far and powerful. I love spraying weeds now. Wish I bought this a long time ago. Also used surfactant (can use dish soap) and blue dye. Wow, I feel like a pro now. This has strong straps, soft cushioning and fits on your back well. Buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Tensy

customer_reviews.title: Great Sprayer!!!
customer_reviews.text: Fo years I have been using a 2-3 gallon sprayer you find at Home Depot or Lowes. They all eventually end up breaking, and I am constantly stopping, pumping, spraying, refilling. I took the plunge and bought The Field King Professional. And I'm so glad I did. JUST HAVING 4 GALLONS made my life sooooo much easier. (I have a large backyard). The sprayer works flawlessly. I'm not pausing to repump - I just keep going, pumping and spraying at the same time. Great product guys! One thing to note - when you fill it up with 4 gallons worth of water - the sprayer gets heavy. Love that it's a backup for that reason.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Bretz

customer_reviews.title: Makes quick work of spraying
customer_reviews.text: I use this for pesticides and annual broadcast weed control on a quarter acre lot. Its a big improvement from my 1 gallon pump sprayer. I'd rather fill this once then fill the pump sprayer 2 or 3 times for the same job. Easy to use but is a struggle to put on by yourself when filled.
customer_reviews.author: Greg White

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This was everything I wanted in a back sprayer. I’m not sure where it came from or where it’s built but it’s not the everyday China crap which is everywhere. The design was Great! The pump action worked perfectly and built a lot of pressure which gave me more spray time! It covers so much more ground than others. In my opinion. It’s well built! It doesn’t hurt picking it up or putting on your back. The strap system was designed to stabilize the weight. Very thought out and thank you. I will definitely buy another one and recommend the product
customer_reviews.author: Jared Shelton

customer_reviews.title: well designed tank
customer_reviews.text: The Field King sprayer is a far better product than I had hoped for. It is well constructed and has great features. I used it with water 1st, to test it. Because of previous purchases from Big Box stores in town, whose tanks both leaked. This tank passed the test flawlessly. Filled the tank with weed killer and sprayed 4 gals on my gravel drive. Needless to say, but not a dribble down my back. 👍👍👍👍👍
customer_reviews.author: krusty

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent sprayer. I highly recommend it. I have a large yard and I was able to spray the entire yard within a very reasonable time. I am very impressed with it. It has a lot of different nozzle heads. You will not be disappointed with this sprayer.
customer_reviews.author: R. S.

customer_reviews.title: Builds pressure quickly. Multiple nozzles. Hand pump handle. Carrying handle. Hose carriage.
customer_reviews.text: Only used twice. Excellent harness comfy and good fit easy to adjust. Multiple uses from the delicate to the harshest vines & blackberry patches.
customer_reviews.author: John Pittman

customer_reviews.title: Great sprayer
customer_reviews.text: This sprayer is great. There are no leaks and the pump handle is easy to use. Very impressive workmanship and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle N.

customer_reviews.title: It works as it should.
customer_reviews.text: Bought a 4 gal backpack from tractor supply. After 1 season it didnt create any pressure. Inspection revealed a rubber piston sleeve had detioriorated. Bought this as a replacement. So far I like it. Would get 5 stars if the wand was metal along with brass spray fittings. The air chamber might develope up to 150psi but volume is key. Be prepared to pump while spraying.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Workman

customer_reviews.title: Good value / sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I love this sprayer used to keep dusty mildew off of my vineyard and fruit trees. Big opening for pouring water or chemicals into the tank. Quality wand works without problems. The crank feels a little loose but has not created any problems after several uses. Good spray and distribution possible with strong pump and air/water tight tank. Comfortable fit.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ray

customer_reviews.title: Good bye hudson sprayer
customer_reviews.text: This unit is sooo much better than the Hudson sprayer I had been using. It allows me to pump while spraying which cuts my spraying time by more than half. If I had to do a lot of spraying I would maybe opt for the battery-powered pump but for the 3-4 times per year, this works great.
customer_reviews.author: R. McCabe

customer_reviews.title: Now I'm Tim Taylor on the TV series, "Home Improvement."
customer_reviews.text: Over the years I have purchased many small portable pump-up sprayers at Walmart, Home Depot and other places, but I ended up throwing each one away after one or two years. I finally did some research and paid the extra $$ for this sprayer. What an amazing difference! Should have gone this route long ago, but live and learn. Now I feel like Tim Taylor on the TV series, "Home Improvement." :)
customer_reviews.author: Dan Knaup

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for spraying trees
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this sprayer based on a previous review that said it could reach 20'. We have crab apple trees that need treatment, and this sprayer did a great job when used with the brass nozzle. The pump action is easy to operate, and the spray reaches to the top of the trees. I found it very comfortable to wear, and no leaks. Very easy to clean up after (hint - there is an in-line filter that needs to be cleaned inside the wand handle - easy to remove.). Very well made. This is a great tool! Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Finally bought backpack sprayer.
customer_reviews.text: Always used 1-2 gal sprayers and was refilling constantly. and they had to be carried. The Field King is very impressive. Pumps easy, easy to strap on even with my larger size., sprays beautifully and does not leak!!!!! I fill it twice for my yard and use the pickup tailgate for a table. Way to go! Rinses well and sprays to within only a few ounces left.
customer_reviews.author: alan gibb

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: This thing makes quick work of spraying. I use it for weed killer and the multiple tips and strength of the spray let's get everything from weeds in my driveway to weeds 10 feet away. No more carrying a tank around and bending over to pump. This thing straps to your back and the easy pump handle is right where you need it. Way easier. Exactly what I was looking for. Thank you Fountainhead Sprayers. You're saving my back every time I use it.
customer_reviews.author: KevinWarren

customer_reviews.title: One star until someone officially addresses the moisture in a new tank
customer_reviews.text: Not cool to think you got a used product. Even less cool, in the age of Covid, to be getting anything in the mail containing a moisture of unknown origin. Sprayed down, cleaned out and it seems to wok well, but someone really needs to explain why people are getting tanks with moisture inside.
customer_reviews.author: J.D. Delanteromano

customer_reviews.title: uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for a little over a year the sprayer works very well, but there is a problem with the back pack straps. The padding does not start until a bout 4" from the top so when I put it on there is no padding where the top of my shoulders are so all the weight is on my shoulders with no padding. So I have sore shoulders by the time I get have way through the tank.
customer_reviews.author: Stanley Marion

customer_reviews.title: Good Sprayer, No leaks
customer_reviews.text: I should have purchased this months ago, been comparing different brands, this sprayer is great and saves time as I have a 1.5 acre lot. Easy to change the pump handle from right to left depending on your preference. Can't go wrong with this, I didn't experience any leakage whatsoever which concerned me with other brands. Use a work bench or table to get it on your back, it gets a bit heavy when fully watered up!!!
customer_reviews.author: OD

customer_reviews.title: Reliable,durable, and inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: I've had this sprayer for three years. I've used it to keep a gravel parking area weed and grass free, same for a paver walkway, and for killing off vegetation in a small field prior to planting a wildflower mix. It has handled everything I've thrown at it and has never even needed maintenance. Even after sitting unused and empty over the winter, it's just fill and go.
customer_reviews.author: Walter Pirie

customer_reviews.title: Read, and follow the instructions...easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this purchase. Easy assembly for what I had to do. I used it to fertilize our flower gardens. We have nine separate flower bedding areas, and I was just elated with the performance of this sprayer. Excellent price for a sprayer that performs this well and is not difficult to use. If you do not have difficulty strapping on a sprayer to your back with the extra weight of the sprayer itself, and the liquid contents, this might be what your looking for.
customer_reviews.author: rainbow

customer_reviews.title: Nice sprayer.
customer_reviews.text: I never owned one of these, always used a 2.5 gallon handheld. after receiving it, I wish I had gotten one back in elementary school. I looked at this one and the max, the max has a little better harness, but the folding handle is a pain in the ars, it dont fold up out of the way for storage. The field king professional arrived very fast and puts out a nice stream. Definitely get your kids one of these. Lol
customer_reviews.author: charles j.

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: Loved this thing. Used to own the small handheld 1 gallon pump which was terrible and a pain to constantly stop, refill and pump. This thing is a beast. Very sturdy and feels premium. Even straps are comfortable. It’s needed out here in AZ; my backyard is dirt for now but do not want to wake up to a weed Forrest. Herbicide sprays evenly and strong.
customer_reviews.author: DJ_Ramo

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use
customer_reviews.text: Simple to put together and to use. Works well and I like that it holds more than a gallon! Storing it upside down as instructed is a little dicey as it doesn't "sit" evenly so I just prop it in a corner leaning against a post. But very handy!
customer_reviews.author: Wallerish

customer_reviews.title: Natural/non toxic product
customer_reviews.text: I really appreciate the fast shipping and packaging. The seller uses recycled components for shipments. This product is commercial food grade vinegar and ocean water. Highly effective at killing all kinds of vegetation and it has zero negative impact on the soil, wildlife, bees, people, pets or ground water. This sort of product is the way to go!
customer_reviews.author: Jaylev

customer_reviews.title: Great Srpayer
customer_reviews.text: ordered 2. had no problems assembling either one. have one that the included pressure regulator locked closed and I had to remove it after the 1st use. The other one has functioned perfectly. The regulator makes for a very even application even when tank is fully pressurized. Please have someone contact me about this so I can get the regulator working again.
customer_reviews.author: Star Pirate

customer_reviews.title: Great sprayer for an oddball job
customer_reviews.text: I used this sprayer with water-based concrete stain on my 2,000 square foot patio. It worked like a dream. I could not have gotten this job done without this sprayer. Now that my patio project is over, I have started using this sprayer to treat my 7 acres of land. Again, I am most impressed at this sprayer's performance now that I'm using it in it's normal capacity. This is the best backpack sprayer out there.
customer_reviews.author: Dave C.

customer_reviews.title: You won't go wrong
customer_reviews.text: Have only used 2 times so far. It works great and the agitater is really good to keep my mixtures from separating. I used to have to take my old backpack off and shake it up. The different nozzels allow you to select just the right spray for what you wish to do. Also the harness is the best I have ever used on a sprayer. very comfortable and highly adjustable. Fits me, 6 foot and my wife 5 foot 2. Highly recommend, for the price can't be beat
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Very well made
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed that this was as sturdy as it is. I would recommend this to anyone tht needs to spray their yard. Easy to carry, less strain on your back. My son uses this to spray everyone’s yard and he has not had any problems. Very well made and would suggest anyone to purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: beware - i received an obviously used and returned item!
customer_reviews.text: 1 star for the fact that this item was clearly used - the tank was still wet inside from whatever the prior owner used, yuck!!!! i mean, 0 stars if i could for receiving a clearly USED ITEM when i paid for a NEW ITEM!!! super disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: rae williams

customer_reviews.title: Short lifespan cheaply produced components inside tank
customer_reviews.text: I have use this for less than three years for about five hours per year. Yesterday the retaining clip inside the tank broke allowing the liquid to run out of it down the back of my legs in my shorts putting round up all over me. Given the low hours on the sprayer I would not recommend to buy this product
customer_reviews.author: Brian Elmer

customer_reviews.title: Returned
customer_reviews.text: Handle does not fold up out if the way as pictured. It stays fully down - perpendicular to the unit. Returned. Spend the extra money and get the upgraded FK Max 190348. Metal wand, foldable and 100% better pump handle.
customer_reviews.author: PenroseTribar

customer_reviews.title: Simple and convenient
customer_reviews.text: I used to use a large 25 gallon powered sprayer, connected to my tractor. Would take over an hour to set up and tear down. I still use that to spray the rock road, but this allows me to keep up with my driveway and around the house quickly and easily. Wish I bought this years ago. Have had it a year, and so far no issues. I hope it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Audiofirst

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and assembe
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to assemble but you have to take in account which hand you use to install both the pump and handle on the correct sides. It's definitely not the most comfortable thing in the world with 4 gallons on your back but it's great when you have a lot of ground to cover.
customer_reviews.author: Terrance Wyatt

customer_reviews.title: Is your yard large or small?
customer_reviews.text: If you have a small yard, you can get by with a hand held sprayer. But I take care of 3 yards and no way would I ever go back to a 2 gallon sprayer. This one is 4 gal and so much easier and faster. It's a bit hard to lift with 4 gallons so maybe fill it on a portable workbench or something so you can slip it on without lifting. But you don't have to stop to pump it up. You pump slowly and evenly as you walk and spray. The high volume tip helps too. I sprayed pre-emergent in about 1/3 the time. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert H Jenney

customer_reviews.title: It works while it works but after that, it doesn’t ~Unhappy Smurf
customer_reviews.text: No leak huh? Then why does my butt look like a Smurf??? It sprung a gushing leak while it was strapped to my back in the woods. There is no way to just tighten the loose fitting, it has to be drained and cleaned to get inside. There is also no way to get a wrench, pliers, or other tools to grip this cap to tighten.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff in the Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Leaks
customer_reviews.text: Unit worked nicely the first couple of times I used it. But within the year it started leaking from the handle which I was able to repair. Then the next year it leak from the bottom of the unit onto my back. Very disappointed. Company needs to upgrade their quality standards to ensure the product will not leak dangerous chemicals onto their customers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: nice to have the waist belt for support
customer_reviews.text: Have always used Solo sprayers and replaced the diaphragm in the last one...it was tricky and time consuming. This Field King operates well, so I hope it gives years of service and if needed, maintenance will be easier than the Solo (the videos indicate it will be). Straps are padded well; nice to have the waist belt for support. Gave it 4 stars instead of 5 since it's a little heavier than the Solo with the same capacity.
customer_reviews.author: BeOutside

customer_reviews.title: Previously used and broken product.
customer_reviews.text: The unit I received head been obviously used and could not hold any pressure (I'm guessing the pump mechanism had been broken). I would have assumed if another customer returned a unit they would at least test to make sure it was still in working order before sending it out again. Very dissatisfied with this situation and now I have to wait for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Ed17

product_meta.title: Field King Professional 190328 No Leak Pump Backpack Sprayer for Killing Weeds in Lawns and Gardens
product_meta.description: Size:4 gallonField King 190328 Professional No Leak Pump Backpack Sprayer does the work of a piston or diaphragm backpack sprayer. The exclusive internal No Leak Pump keeps your back and clothing dry. The paddles keep liquids, powders, and water-soluble solutions mixed, in solution, and ready to spray. Also the pump features Viton seals that can be easily changed within minutes without tools (up to 7x faster than the leading competitor). The premium shut-off offers a comfort grip, lockable trigger to prevent hand fatigue, and a removable in-line filter to reduce clogging. The Field King 190328 Backpack Sprayer is capable of spraying up to 150 PSI - perfect for those hard-to-reach areas. The included pressure regulator maintains a low, continuous 25 PSI (great for spraying herbicides and weed killers). The tank has a built-in carry handle with wand storage. With adjustable padded straps, waist belt and chest cinch strap, the backpack ensures comfort while you work. Multiple nozzles are included for ultimate versatility: brass adjustable nozzle (enables stream to cone patterns), wide flat fan nozzle (red, 0.25 GPM, angled at 70°), narrow flat fan nozzle (yellow, 0.15 GPM, angled at 30°), and foaming nozzle. Also accepts TeeJet nozzles.
feature_bullets: Internal No Leak Pump design is safer to use chemicals will not drip down your back. Internal piston pump delivers up to 150 PSI
Durable, 21 inch poly wand with the highest quality Viton seals can be used with Wet table powders and liquids for all applications does the work of both a piston and diaphragm backpack
Premium, lockable shut off with brass components and an in-line filter.
Easy access pump allows changing of seals in just minutes with no tools
4 nozzles included: brass adjustable, 2 flat fans, and foaming nozzle. Also accepts Tee Jet nozzles.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars1,739 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
